Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video shows anti-CAA protesters throwing stones at police officers in Delhi, when in reality it shows an incident in the Ahmedabad area of Gujarat.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading Facebook post and does not provide substantial evidence to prove the assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video is related to the anti-CAA protests in Delhi, which is a problematic assumption as it is not supported by the evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video actually shows an incident during an anti-CAA protest in the Shah-e-Alam area of Ahmedabad, Gujarat, as shown in the TV9 Gujarati video.
Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the situation by linking the incident to terrorism and suggesting that it is being controlled from Rawalpindi, without providing any evidence to support such claims.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
